meanings.definition: To cry or scream loudly and harshly.
meanings.sent1: The baby started to skrike when she dropped her toy.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house made me want to skrike in fear.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to skrike at the most unexpected times, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sirens of the ambulance seemed to skrike through the silent night.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm made the frightened dog skrike uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: A loud, harsh cry or scream.
meanings.sent1: The skrike of the eagle echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The skrike of the owl could be heard in the dark forest.
meanings.sent3: The skrike of the seagulls woke me up early in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The skrike of the brakes startled the pedestrians on the street.
meanings.sent5: The skrike of the microphone feedback made everyone cover their ears.
